channel.title: Boot Linux on 128MB USB drive!
channel.description:
This walkthrough illustrates how to install an entire linux operating system, Damn Small Linux (DSL) to a USB stick from within Windows. Damn Small Linux is perfect for smaller USB drives, and can be booted from or even run from within windows! See list of some applications that DSL comes with here: http://www.damnsmalllinux.org/applications.html. The apps include multiple browsers including FireFox, a word processor, an email client, an image editor and a picture viewer, a pretty nice file manager, an AOL-based instant messaging client, VoIP, GUI text, spreadsheet, PDF editor, and much more, contained inside less than 128 MB!
You’ll need the following: • 128MB or larger USB Stick • Damn Small Linux v3.1 • HP USB tool (for formatting the stick) • Syslinux V3.31
(See download links at bottom)
The Process: 1. Download the HP USB tool and format your stick with the tool using the Fat or Fat32 option. 2. Download the dsl-3.1-embedded.zip 3. Extract the files from dsl-3.1-embedded.zip to your USB stick. 4. Download and extract syslinux-3.31.zip to a directory on your computer. 5. Run the command prompt in windows (start/run/cmd) and CD to the syslinux directory, then to the win32 directory. Once there simply type syslinux.exe F: (F: being the example drive letter of the USB stick in this system) 6. Reboot your PC, go into your system BIOS and set your boot order to boot from any selectable USB device. (example USBZIP or USB_HDD) 7. Save your BIOS settings. On the next reboot, you should have a sucessful launch of Damn Small Linux from USB.
Enjoy your OS on a stick.
Download links:
Damn Small Linux download - http://gulus.usherbrooke.ca/pub/distro/DamnSmallLinux/current/dsl-3.1-embedded.zip
Syslinux download - http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/boot/syslinux/syslinux-3.31.zip
HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool - http://www.pctipp.ch/library/actions/pre_download.asp?id=7595
IMPORTANT: Author: ~The Pendrive Doctor~ Article Source: http://www.pendrivelinux.com
This guide WAS NOT made by me, and I take no credit for it aside from finding it and updating the guide and links. Other than that this was made by The Pendrive Doctor at http://www.pendrivelinux.com.
Enjoy!
EDIT: Note: DSL can also run off of your USB drive INSIDE windows. So you can use it's browser to bypass BESS at your school or something. =)

I have important files on my Flash Stick, will it delete them if I change the format? I know it seems a dumb question and I think I already know the answer lolz.

item.title: Boot Linux on 128MB USB drive!
item.dc:creator: @bumr055 bumr055
item.description:
@bumr055 wrote:

haha… i got suspended for using this lol… my dick teacher “froze” my account because i was working on “drug related activities” and i was like “wtf dude?!?” and he went to the office to rat on me…

so i grabbed my handy dsl(tobad they blocked firefox from connecting somehow)… and i was messing around with some drawing apps and he came back and asked me to come with him and im like “why, wtf did i do buddy??” so i shut down linux took a cupple ocward minutes and then when we were at the door…

hes like “what did you just do to my computer” and im like “you kicked me off windows, so i booted up linux”
and he said i had to go to the office for “bypassing the schools security protocol” …
and him knowing me well enough he was gunna escort me there so i didnt just leave (like usual) but, what is he gunna do lol… use force, no he cant do shit so i just walked away…

i over heard my mom talking to sombody after school on the phone and thats when i found out i was suspended she was probably telling my granny or somthing…

ya, so i was suspended all week(to bad i got sick) im not sure how long more im gunna be suspended but, i also cant do my co-op becuase it was gunna be computer related and im in grade 10 and it was only avalible because they know im not gunna go to school, i skip everyday.

thats the story, dont get cought using linux to “bypass your schools security protocol” lol

Read full topic

item.title: Boot Linux on 128MB USB drive!
item.dc:creator: @bumr055 bumr055
item.description:
@bumr055 wrote:

THANKS A BUNCH DUDE!!!..

im gunna bring this to school tomorrow and see how firefox works…

i dont think they can block me getting in to the BIOS so it should be good

thanks again man!!

edit: ok… i like how it comes with firefox and whatnot… but i was trying to find where that file was located and couldn’t…

i wanted to download a msn messenger for linux and put it on there too for at school but cant figure it out…
…

some questions i have are…

when i did that thing with cmd, would i have to do that at school too or was that just somthing to program the usb drive?
…
i was thinking about what that thing was and…
if i put that syslinux file on the usb drive and did the cmd thing and directed it to that would that make it work without downloading it everywhere i go?(this only matters if my first question’s answer is “yes”)

thanks, bumross

Read full topic

item.title: Boot Linux on 128MB USB drive!
item.dc:creator: @Slayerexpert Slayerexpert
item.description:
@Slayerexpert wrote:

This walkthrough illustrates how to install an entire linux operating system, Damn Small Linux (DSL) to a USB stick from within Windows. Damn Small Linux is perfect for smaller USB drives, and can be booted from or even run from within windows! See list of some applications that DSL comes with here: http://www.damnsmalllinux.org/applications.html. The apps include multiple browsers including FireFox, a word processor, an email client, an image editor and a picture viewer, a pretty nice file manager, an AOL-based instant messaging client, VoIP, GUI text, spreadsheet, PDF editor, and much more, contained inside less than 128 MB!

You’ll need the following:
• 128MB or larger USB Stick
• Damn Small Linux v3.1
• HP USB tool (for formatting the stick)
• Syslinux V3.31

(See download links at bottom)

The Process:

  1. Download the HP USB tool and format your stick with the tool using the Fat or Fat32 option.
  2. Download the dsl-3.1-embedded.zip
  3. Extract the files from dsl-3.1-embedded.zip to your USB stick.
  4. Download and extract syslinux-3.31.zip to a directory on your computer.
  5. Run the command prompt in windows (start/run/cmd) and CD to the syslinux directory, then to the win32 directory. Once there simply type syslinux.exe F: (F: being the example drive letter of the USB stick in this system)
  6. Reboot your PC, go into your system BIOS and set your boot order to boot from any selectable USB device. (example USBZIP or USB_HDD)
  7. Save your BIOS settings. On the next reboot, you should have a sucessful launch of Damn Small Linux from USB.

Enjoy your OS on a stick.

Download links:

Damn Small Linux download - http://gulus.usherbrooke.ca/pub/distro/DamnSmallLinux/current/dsl-3.1-embedded.zip

Syslinux download -
http://www.kernel.org/pub/linux/utils/boot/syslinux/syslinux-3.31.zip

HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool -
http://www.pctipp.ch/library/actions/pre_download.asp?id=7595

Author: ~The Pendrive Doctor~
